Original question: A neutron star whose mass is M = 1.4 M_{\odot} and radius is R = 10 km is in orbit about a normal star. Matter is flowing from the normal star onto the collapsed star at a rate of \dot{M} = 10^{17} grams per second. Assume that all of the gravitational potential energy of the infalling matter is converted to radiation. Compute the bolometric luminosity of the neutron star.
